author: Nistula Hebbar
text:
Entering the poll ring again after the debacle in Bihar, the BJP seems to have learnt its lessons, at least when it comes to deploying its most important campaign asset — Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

For Assam, the only State where the BJP fancies its chances among the four States and one Union territory going to the polls, the BJP has scheduled only six public meetings of Mr. Modi till now. This is in stark contrast to his 40 rallies in Bihar.

Top sources in the BJP said the PM’s programme would also involve an overnight stay at Jorhat. “On March 26, he will address four rallies — in Tinsukia, Bihpura, Majuli [the party’s chief ministerial candidate Sarbananda Sonowal’s seat] and Borakhat,” said a senior party office-bearer.

In West Bengal too, only six rallies are planned. “We let the Bihar campaign be about everything other than Bihar. We will not make that mistake in Assam,” said the source.
title: PM to address fewer rallies
